Name: Head of a serpent
Description: The head of a cobra, in green faience. The tangs would have helped to secure the head to a body in another material. At el-`Amarna stone cobra heads form friezes over shrines, and it is possible that this cobra also belonged to a series protecting a shrine of various materials. It was found at Memphis, and dated by the excavator to the 19th Dynasty, a period from which such heads are rare.
